intro: Physaria newberryi subsp. yesicola, commonly known as the yesicola bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale blue to lavender in color. It is well adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
